results.title: Winners : Just friends
results.creator_credit: Michael Pattinson, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Winners Series”.
Susan has just moved to a new part of town. It’s school holidays and she goes to practice her skills at the local roller rink. Buzz, the Prince of the rink, spots the talented newcomer and moves in on her. Susan joins Buzz and his gang - but she doesn’t know what she is letting herself in for. Rated: G

results.title: Activity sampling: a training film
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures and David Stevens
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the technique by simulating a real-life office situation. It aims at giving students practice in distinguishing between the various activities observed and calculating results from their observations.

results.title: Queenscliff beaches; Our journey
results.creator_credit: Queenscliff Primary School and Paul Jones
results.brief_description:
This film is a learning outcome from the “Beaches” group student led investigation program at Queenscliff Primary School. It was undertaken as part of the 2007 Snapshots of Remote Communities Project and was overall winner of the Annual Sprockets and Flares Multimedia Awards.
A combination of softwares including Blue Sky technologies and artwork by the students was used in the creation of this work.
Two versions are included:
1. Queenscliff beaches - final product
2. Our journey - details the behind-the-scenes and process

results.title: Waltzing Matilda
results.creator_credit: John Morris, South Australian Film Corporation, Michael Chataway and Michael Cusack
results.brief_description: In this humorous claymation dramatisation of Banjo Paterson’s famous poem, all of the characters, with the exception of the ill-fated sheep thief, are transformed into animals. Shot on a set designed to replicate Russell Drysdale’s Outback paintings, the film brings to life and explains the terminology of the lyrics.

results.title: The Plains of Heaven
results.brief_description: In this inversion of the buddy-film two technicians manning a tracking station on the High Plains pursue diametrically opposed ways of coping with the isolation. The ageing Cunningham seems to be rejuvenated by and obsessed with the landscape while the younger Barker withdraws into the station and its attendant technology. Return to Barker’s Melbourne becomes a descent into a fragmented, nightmare cityscape. The denial of cause and effect explanations for behaviour invites a metaphysical interpretation of this ambiguously down-side existential drama of disorientation and alienation not dissimilar to Werner Herzog’s visionary dramas although without the German director’s quirky black humour. Cast: Richard Moir, Reg Evans, Gerard Kennedy.

results.title: Blokes and sheds - Mick
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation, Australian Film Commission, Sarah Wishart, Mark Thomson and Robi Watt
results.brief_description:
One of 12 minidocos about blokes and their sheds in South Australia.
Mick’s obsession with trains began when he was a young boy growing up in Prague. He began constructing his model train world for his grandchildren many years ago. However, when they grew up and lost interest, Mick’s interest continued to grow. Mick’s shed contains another world. In it are miniature houses, people, trees and animals, all set around a train line with a “Swiss” alpine backdrop complete with snow capped mountains. Mick spends his time in his shed perfecting his miniature world and making continuous repairs, additions and alterations. Based on the book by Mark Thomson.
